alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 2:49AM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches with 10 to 20 inches in the central Wasatch and Uintas, locally higher amounts in the Upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains and Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Be prepared for periods of winter driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull in snowfall appears likely Tuesday afternoon and early evening. Two periods of heavier snowfall are expected with the first Monday night and the second Tuesday night through Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
